dooyit.ui

Class UIController

  • java.lang.Object
    • dooyit.ui.UIController

  • public class UIController
extends java.lang.Object
    The UIController class contains methods to initialize all other classes belonging to the UI. This is the only class from dooyit.ui that communicates directly with the Logic component. All communication between UI and Logic happens through it. The UIController class follows the Singleton design pattern, hence its constructor method is private. It can be constructed using the getInstance method.
    Since:
    2016-04-10
    Version:
    0.5
    Author:
    Wu Wenqi

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static UIController getInstance(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        This method is used to create an instance of UIController and return it, if it has not already been created. If an instance of UIController already exists, no new instance will be created and the existing UIController will be returned instead. This method is used by the Main class.
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - This is the primary stage of the application.
        Returns:
        The UIController instance.

        Returns:

      • initRoot

        private void initRoot()
        This method is used to initialize the root view. The root view is the underlying view that contains all the other views. Make sure this method is only called after all other views have been initialized. This method is used by the initialize method.
